==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𤣩}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
The character's shape was historically very similar to {{zh-l|*王}}; a dot was introduced to differentiate the two. It originally meant “blemished jade”. {{lang|zh|玉}} can also be found written as {{zh-l|玊|sù}} for the same reason.

{{liushu|p}}: a picture of a [[w:Cong_(jade)|cong]] ({{zh-l|*琮}}), a sort of ritual jade totem.

It is also interpreted as three pieces of jade strung together on a string.
